intro: Pelargonium candidum, commonly known as the white geranium, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers due to its compact size and ornamental value. The flowers are often used in floral arrangements, adding a delicate and elegant touch.
